abstract: The Upshot; analysis of insurance rate filings in 18 states conducted by McKinsey Center for US Health System Reform finds that many customers will find it difficult to avoid large price increases in health insurance premiums by shopping for cheaper plans.

headline.print_headline: Cost of Health Law’s Plans Set to Rise More Sharply
headline.main: Obamacare Premiums Set to Rise, Even for Savvy Shoppers

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject

keywords.value: McKinsey Center for US Health System Reform
keywords.name: organizations

snippet: Prices for the most popular plans in 18 states are rising by 11 percent, doubling last year’s increase, according to a new analysis....
lead_paragraph: Prices for the most popular plans in 18 states are rising by 11 percent, doubling last year’s increase, according to a new analysis.
